Class CuePointProperties | Methods
 
Packagecom.brightcove.brightaction.model
Classpublic class CuePoint

The CuePoint object is a marker set at a precise time point in the duration of a video.

Constructor detail
CuePoint()constructor
public function CuePoint(name:String, type:CuePointTypeEnum, time:Number, videoId:Number, forceStop:Boolean = false, metadata:String = "")

Class constructor, create an instance of a Cue Point.

Parameters
name:String — Required. A name for the cue point, so that you can refer to it.
 
type:CuePointTypeEnum — Required. An integer code corresponding to the type of cue point. One of 0 (AD), 1 (CODE), or 2 (CHAPTER). An AD cue point is used to trigger mid-roll ad requests. A CHAPTER cue point indicates a chapter or scene break in the video. A CODE cue point causes an event that you can listen for and respond to.
 
time:Number — Required. The time of the cue point, measured in milliseconds from the beginning of the video.
 
videoId:Number — A comma-separated list of the ids of one or more videos that this cue point applies to.
 
forceStop:Boolean (default = false) — If true, the video stops playback at the cue point. This setting is valid only for AD type cue points.
 
metadata:String (default = "") — A string that can be passed along with a CODE cue point.
